intro: Sulcolluma shadhbana var. barhana, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
